.
Effect of Incarceration on Pension Awards
When a beneficiary entitled to pension is incarcerated for more than 60 days following conviction of a felony
or misdemeanor
,
38 CFR 3.666
requires VA to discontinue payments of pension.
Before discontinuing
Veterans Pension
due to incarceration, review the claims folder to determine whether the Veteran is also entitled to
disability compensation
.  If entitlement to both benefits exists, follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.B.3
.
References
:  For more information on
the effect of an
apportionee’s
incarceration on an apportionment, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.C.6
processing notices of incarceration, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.A.3.a
, and
the apportionment of an incarcerated
Veteran’s pension to dependents, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.B.1
, and
38 CFR 3.666(a)
surviving spouse’s pension to eligible children, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.C.2
, and
38 CFR 3.666(b)(1)
, and
child’s pension to a surviving spouse or other eligible children, see
38 CFR 3.666(b)(2)
.
